intro: Alsine pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf alsike, is a small annual herb belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are pale green to yellowish, clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, dry fruits. Alsine pusilla is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
